nodes.title: Funerary Structures FS2 and FS3
nodes.body: Funerary structures FS2 and FS3 appear to be the remains of two cubic tombs but very little of these structures survives (26.863΄ / 10.699΄ / 4650 m). They are located higher up the ridgeback from FS1.

nodes.title: Mi lam khyi lam and Khyi mchong la group
Funerary Structure FS4
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS4 (2.8 m x 1.6 m x 70 cm [maximum height]) is situated on a subsidiary summit of the ridgeline, on ground lightly strewn with talus (26.802΄ / 10.603΄ / 4690 m). Although part of the cubic tomb has been leveled, a small portion of its central depository (reliquary) is intact. Due to the dissolution of he structure, it could not be determined whether it was aligned in the cardinal directions.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS5
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS5 (2.8 m 1.6 m x 1 m) is located in the vicinity of FS4 in an analogous setting (26.780΄ / 10.572΄ / 4700 m). The middle of the structure has been gutted, therefore the size of the central depository is no longer evident. In this large hollow in the structure there are traces of osteological materials. A small bone fragment, possibly belonging to a human, was collected from this cubic tomb and subjected to chronometric analysis.84 While the provenance of the assayed sample is unclear, it demonstrates that bones upwards of 1000 years old found their way into cubic tombs. The dated bone fragment may possibly have been part of an original interment or deposited as part of a subsequent adventitious burial. It is also possible that its deposition was a matter of happenstance.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS6
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS6 is situated 7.5 m west of FS5 on the ridge-top. It has been reduced to traces of the foundation.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS7
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS7 (2.8 m x 1.8 m x 60 cm) is situated just below the precipitous south side of the ridge-top on a slope lightly strewn with talus (26.776΄ / 10.621΄ / 4690 m). This location is in close proximity to the Milam KhyilamMi lam khyi lam and Khyichong LaKhyi mchong la passes. It overlooks he juncture of the Tarap TsoRta rabs mtsho and Oma Tso’O ma mtsho lake basins, a powerful geomantic configuration.85 FS7 appears to have been aligned in the cardinal directions. The top of the structure has been completed engulfed by rubble.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS8
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS8 (1.6 m x 1.6 m x 60 cm) is situated on the east side of Khyichong LaKhyi mchong la (26.808΄ / 10.422΄ / 4690 m). The walls of this tomb were probably aligned in the cardinal directions but too little remains in place to know for certain.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS9
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS9 (2.4 m x 4 m x 1 m to 1.3 m) is situated less than 2 m away from FS8. This unusually large specimen is not well aligned in the compass points. Its central depository measures 2.3 m x 90 cm, and is one of the only such internal spaces in any cubic tomb surveyed to date that could have potentially accommodated a whole adult corpse. There is still one in situ stone (1.1 m long) capping the 70-cm deep central depository.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS10
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS10 (1.7 m x 2.5 m x 90 cm) is situated on the west side of Khyichong LaKhyi mchong la (26.823΄ / 10.319΄ / 4700 m). The op of this structure is completely filled with rubble.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS13
nodes.body:
Funerary structure FS13 is situated on the summit, 6 m west of FS12. It is a similarly sized and constructed structure but in a much more degraded condition.

Funerary structure FS14

Funerary structure FS14 is situated in close proximity to FS13 (27.014΄ / 10.033΄ / 4780 m). This smaller structure has been leveled. FS14 appears to be the remains of a cubic tomb.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS16
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS16 (2.5 m x 1.9 m x 1 m) is situated much higher up the ridge-top (27.023 / 09.766 / 4880m). Its central depository is largely intact and well aligned in the cardinal directions: it measures 75 cm (east-west) x 40 cm (north-south) x 60 cm deep.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS17
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS17 (2.6 m x 2.4 m x 1.1 m) is located on the summit at a slightly higher elevation than FS16 (27.011΄ / 09.747΄). The remains of its central depository are filled with earth and stones.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS18
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS18 (1.8 m x 1.8 m x 1 m) is located higher up the summit ridge and overlooks the sheer south side of the mountain (27.009΄ / 09.601΄ / 4930 m). The mostly intact central depository is not well aligned in the cardinal directions and measures 40 cm x 50 cm x 70 deep. This is one of the best preserved cubic tombs at the Milam KhyilamMi lam khyi lam site.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS19
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS19 (2.3 m x 1.9 m x 1 m) is also one of the best preserved cubic tombs at the site (27.014 / 09 585 / 4930 m). The large central depository is well aligned in the cardinal directions and measures 1 m (east-west) x m (60 cm) x 60 cm (depth).

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS20
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS20 (1.4 m x 1.8 m x 70 cm) is located just below the south side of the summit, higher up he ridgeline (26.978΄ / 09.371΄ / 4980 m). FS20, a largely collapsed cubic tomb, is surrounded by rock ledges on three sides.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS21
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS21 is located on the summit, a few meters from FS20. This almost entirely destroyed specimen is not fully identifiable.

nodes.title: Notes
nodes.body:
[83] oroko rog is the word for crow (porokpo rog) in the local dialect.
[84] FS5: AMS analysis, sample no. Beta-200757; conventional radiocarbon age: 940 +/-50 BP; 2 Sigma calibrated result: Cal 950 to 740 BP; intercept of radiocarbon age with calibration curve: Cal 910 BP; 1 Sigma calibrated result: Cal 930 to 780 BP.
[85] Oma Tso’O ma mtsho is so named because its opaque waters resemble milk.
